commit_message:
Attach/detach interface to paused instance with affect live flag

Currently attach/detach interface to paused instance is only with
VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CONFIG flags. After instance unpause, there isn't
any effect on the instance, unless restart the instance. So add
flag VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE when attach/detach interface.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: Iedfc7f6fc06e72d8e3eecebede1274582c8043fd
Closes-Bug: #1299331
(cherry picked from commit a868fcedf8e46070cae6aa8e59e61934fa23db1c)

commit_message:
Do not pass instances without host to compute API

Even if the server external events extension filters out events
whose related instance does not have a host, the corresponding
instance is still sent to the compute API module.
As this might result in KeyError, instance without host should
be filtered out before calling the compute API module.

Change-Id: If5229ec3059076dbc9f4abb6625504e8864c265e
Closes-Bug: #1348584
(cherry picked from commit 5e4a5f0d8c62ca6e94ae6db16e9fbe0428805158)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-27 08:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/server_external_events.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_server_external_events.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Do not process events for instances without host

In some cases Neutron might send events such as 'VIF unplugged'
for instances which are either being deleted or shelved. When
that happens there will be a failure in dispatching the event
to the appropriate compute node - as there is no host for the
instance.

As multiple neutron events can be stashed in a single call
it is important to avoid that this kind of errors will prevent
processing of other events in the same call.

This patch does not process events for instances without a host,
marking them as failed.

When the above condition occurs, the create event request will
return a 207 response code. For specific events, a 422
unprocessable entity code will be set.

This patch also preserve the characteristic that events are
returned in the response in the same order they were found in
the request.

Change-Id: I18062b81e50c722ec96b4296ac39384493683ae3
Closes-Bug: #1333654
(cherry picked from commit 4f8ccd7b95c27180a1cfe689e3c6f46bde5f803b)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not process events for instances without host

In some cases Neutron might send events such as 'VIF unplugged'
for instances which are either being deleted or shelved. When
that happens there will be a failure in dispatching the event
to the appropriate compute node - as there is no host for the
instance.

As multiple neutron events can be stashed in a single call
it is important to avoid that this kind of errors will prevent
processing of other events in the same call.

This patch does not process events for instances without a host,
marking them as failed.

When the above condition occurs, the create event request will
return a 207 response code. For specific events, a 422
unprocessable entity code will be set.

This patch also preserve the characteristic that events are
returned in the response in the same order they were found in
the request.

Change-Id: I18062b81e50c722ec96b4296ac39384493683ae3
Closes-Bug: #1333654
(cherry picked from commit 4f8ccd7b95c27180a1cfe689e3c6f46bde5f803b)

commit_message:
Disable broken unit test (related to "Change Password")

The new django_openstack_auth 1.1.6 library surfaced a defect in this
test, whereby the test client does not properly log out the user. This
only affects the test, the functionality otherwise works fine.

This temporarily disables the test in order to repair the gate, while
waiting to replace it with a new unit test more reduced in scope and/or
an integration test.

Change-Id: I8779666c053a4835e22038a39a530fe5fc84b6a3
Closes-Bug: #1333144
(cherry picked from commit 5455b8f6f595633513b6521449ebc1985d5b9070)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-29 16:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but ceilometer unittests don't currently

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but ceilometer unittests don't currently
pass with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: Ibc613d77ad52d5f7d8d613f3dd66ffba4117ff72
(cherry picked from commit 860a2852ca92df20fa886cec2e75d753ac6e18bb)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-18 13:01:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/security_groups/views.py'], 'message': "Avoid AttributeError: SecurityGroup error handle

On the project/access_and_security/security_groups/<detail> page, some
errors inside the
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/
project/access_and_security/security_groups/views
DetailView._get_data method are still resulting in a None being
returned. This causes an error in the DetailView.get_data method as
NoneTypes clearly don't have a .rules attribute.

I'm not sure why the error is sneaking through the exceptions.handle
above, but they most definitely are. Perhaps Ana Krivokapic's changes
here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84109/ may eventually solve this,
but it's unclear.

In the mean time, and potentially correct overall, if a None is
returned, the get_data method should return an empty list instead of
throwing an exception.

Change-Id: Ibc3bbb8c1302fca0c8a134abee8b7c649ad8c315
Closes-Bug: 1312192
(cherry picked from commit d8bafff484b6ed264af913af3709e61976bc2177)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid AttributeError: SecurityGroup error handle

On the project/access_and_security/security_groups/<detail> page, some
errors inside the
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/
project/access_and_security/security_groups/views
DetailView._get_data method are still resulting in a None being
returned. This causes an error in the DetailView.get_data method as
NoneTypes clearly don't have a .rules attribute.

I'm not sure why the error is sneaking through the exceptions.handle
above, but they most definitely are. Perhaps Ana Krivokapic's changes
here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84109/ may eventually solve this,
but it's unclear.

In the mean time, and potentially correct overall, if a None is
returned, the get_data method should return an empty list instead of
throwing an exception.

Change-Id: Ibc3bbb8c1302fca0c8a134abee8b7c649ad8c315
Closes-Bug: 1312192
(cherry picked from commit d8bafff484b6ed264af913af3709e61976bc2177)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-31 13:39:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova-compute-instance.yaml', 'overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Add strict dependencies to the overcloud template

Currently there is very weak (no) ordering of StructuredDeployments during
heat stack creation (and, importantly, update) on the overcloud. This can
cause the deployment which sends the completion signal back to Heat to
happen before all others have completed, which in turn leads Heat to state
the stack is ready while ORC is still configuring services

The only workaround to this is to wait an unknown amount of time after the
heat stack completes before the system is usable.

This patch prevents the completion signal from being returned early, by
ensuring these are strictly ordered:
    controller0Deploy
    controller0Passthrough
    controller0AllNodesDeploy
    NovaCompute0Deploy
    NovaCompute0Passthrough
    NovaCompute0AllNodesDeploy

Change-Id: I0a549370b7aca55b1145de521ad51218428deaf5
'}]
commit_message:
Add strict dependencies to the overcloud template

Currently there is very weak (no) ordering of StructuredDeployments during
heat stack creation (and, importantly, update) on the overcloud. This can
cause the deployment which sends the completion signal back to Heat to
happen before all others have completed, which in turn leads Heat to state
the stack is ready while ORC is still configuring services

The only workaround to this is to wait an unknown amount of time after the
heat stack completes before the system is usable.

This patch prevents the completion signal from being returned early, by
ensuring these are strictly ordered:
    controller0Deploy
    controller0Passthrough
    controller0AllNodesDeploy
    NovaCompute0Deploy
    NovaCompute0Passthrough
    NovaCompute0AllNodesDeploy

Change-Id: I0a549370b7aca55b1145de521ad51218428deaf5

subject: Restrict users from downloading protected image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-20 21:58:39.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/api/middleware/cache.py', 'glance/tests/etc/property-protections-policies.conf', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_property_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_cache_middleware.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/common/property_utils.py', 'glance/tests/etc/property-protections.conf'], 'message': 'Restrict users from downloading protected image

Added download operation to the protected properties.

For example,
[^x_billing_code_ntt_xyz.*]
create = admin,owner
read = admin,Member,_member_
update = admin,owner
delete = admin,owner
download= admin,owner

Currently, property protection is defined only for Create, Read, Update
and Delete (CRUD) operations. In addition to this Download operation need
to be added in order to restrict downloading image having protected
properties.

Modified v1 and v2 api to add download restriction.
Modified logic of caching to restrict download for v1 and v2 api.

To use this feature, intended user need to deploy two glance-api services
with common glanc registry and backend.
One api would be specific to nova where user will configure policy to allow
any user to download the image whereas in another set, it will restrict user
from downloading the image if you have enabled protected properties policy.

DocImpact: Need to modify following options in glance-api.conf file to enable
property-protections:

property_protection_file = property-protections-roles.conf
property_protection_rule_format = roles

Deployer need to create or modify "property-protections-roles.conf" as per
requirement to define accessible roles for protected property.

Change-Id: I4e10871832eb84ef91c3585ef8f7b61f38040b53
blueprint: restrict-downloading-images-protected-properties
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict users from downloading protected image

Added download operation to the protected properties.

For example,
[^x_billing_code_ntt_xyz.*]
create = admin,owner
read = admin,Member,_member_
update = admin,owner
delete = admin,owner
download= admin,owner

Currently, property protection is defined only for Create, Read, Update
and Delete (CRUD) operations. In addition to this Download operation need
to be added in order to restrict downloading image having protected
properties.

Modified v1 and v2 api to add download restriction.
Modified logic of caching to restrict download for v1 and v2 api.

To use this feature, intended user need to deploy two glance-api services
with common glanc registry and backend.
One api would be specific to nova where user will configure policy to allow
any user to download the image whereas in another set, it will restrict user
from downloading the image if you have enabled protected properties policy.

DocImpact: Need to modify following options in glance-api.conf file to enable
property-protections:

property_protection_file = property-protections-roles.conf
property_protection_rule_format = roles

Deployer need to create or modify "property-protections-roles.conf" as per
requirement to define accessible roles for protected property.

Change-Id: I4e10871832eb84ef91c3585ef8f7b61f38040b53
blueprint: restrict-downloading-images-protected-properties

subject: Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-01 17:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota

If quota on ports are disabled in neutron (see below), neutronv2 api
set port quota to None and quota check raises a TypeError.

  # neutron server /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
  [quotas]
  quota_items=network,subnet,router,floatingip

This change set port quota to -1 (unlimited) if quota on ports are
disabled.

Change-Id: I89c530dd57a7beb35695be124ca8511148378458
Closes-Bug: #1333315
(cherry picked from commit 04add2ed0d8b0341ea347ac98834f75cf5b2be1d)
'}]
commit_message:
Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota

If quota on ports are disabled in neutron (see below), neutronv2 api
set port quota to None and quota check raises a TypeError.

  # neutron server /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
  [quotas]
  quota_items=network,subnet,router,floatingip

This change set port quota to -1 (unlimited) if quota on ports are
disabled.

Change-Id: I89c530dd57a7beb35695be124ca8511148378458
Closes-Bug: #1333315
(cherry picked from commit 04add2ed0d8b0341ea347ac98834f75cf5b2be1d)

commit_message:
Use keystone.host in stackrc

/root/stackrc has a hardcoded value of localhost for OS_AUTH_URL,
which doesn't help when we can't talk to it due to VIP changes. Set
it to keystone.host.

Change-Id: If952f383e8970e3298c36cdd750f6c6a20209e81

commit_message:
Support dpdkvhost in LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

Propose to extend LibvirtGenericVIFDriver class to support
dpdkvhost. This will allow Openvswitch derivatives that
use Intel(R) DPDK to be used with Openstack.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-ovs-use-usvhost

Change-Id: Ibcf7d5354e39fa3ad4d021acff8d3e3e50c0900d

commit_message:
VMware: use default values in get_info() when properties are missing

The properties that we retrieve from VirtualMachineConfigSummary are
optional ('summary.config.numCpu', 'summary.config.memorySizeMB') and
if they are missing we should return default values from get_info()

This patch also improves the unit test for get_info(). It removes the
test in test_driver_api.py (test_get_info() and test_spawn() are the
same) and adds a new test in test_vmops.py

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py
	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py

Closes-Bug: 1317912
Change-Id: Ibbb28985d13de371fdac8a119ad820d25acc21be
(cherry picked from commit 2db7528ca258d7b0c1205ab2f9a76569d9f9a82d)

commit_message:
controller0AllNodesConfig to controller0AllNodes.

Rename all occurrences of controller0AllNodesConfig to
controller0AllNodes as this is in line with compute node
deployments. Also the current naming is confusing as this is a
deployment step not a configuration step.

to proxy-server.conf.

commit_message:
Logging audit for trove/guestagent/backup module

Adjust logging to conform to logging standards.
Cleaned up some messages that were unclear. Also
corrected the usage of the word Backup which was
inconsistently capitalized in some messages.

Also addressed a pattern of exception handlers using
LOG.error merely to log the exception (instead of
using LOG.exception)

Change-Id: Id2eb57d3395273f9aebd41de0146f7a2fc2774c8
Partial-Bug: #1324206

If an instance has an empty security group list an exception
is thrown due to iteration attempt of None.

To fix this, this patch modifies get_instance_security_group

Change-Id: I7efb3c3a58d7e20501d126c6d194479ca1d14166

(cherry picked from commit c32986966dfd034c3d706b2e9ab2820a2c3cfc3e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix security group list when not defined for an instance

If an instance has an empty security group list an exception
is thrown due to iteration attempt of None.

To fix this, this patch modifies get_instance_security_group
to return an empty list instead of None.

Change-Id: I7efb3c3a58d7e20501d126c6d194479ca1d14166
Closes-Bug: #1291489
(cherry picked from commit c32986966dfd034c3d706b2e9ab2820a2c3cfc3e)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-19 22:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add support for os_region_name

For environments with multiple endpoints due to regions, tasks such as
cinder volume attach will not work unless os_region_name is set. This
allows the os_region_name to be passed in.

Change-Id: I5cc41385741054281dafb501742a0d7b26099f88
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for os_region_name

For environments with multiple endpoints due to regions, tasks such as
cinder volume attach will not work unless os_region_name is set. This
allows the os_region_name to be passed in.

commit_message:
Do not schedule network when creating reserved DHCP port

If device_id is DEVICE_ID_RESERVED_DHCP_PORT, do not schedule
network nor notify to dhcp-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1327000
Change-Id: Idf88767596bf0fc31bf856a423d35cb1575b57f3

subject: assertTrue/False should have msg param
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-21 12:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': "assertTrue/False should have msg param

assertTrue / False should really have a msg param. Otherwise we
get the extremely descriptive True != False when the test fails.
Some times, that's ok.

But in the base case it's not. This doesn't yet fix any of the
issues, but is posted for consideration about whether we think
this would be helpful.

Change-Id: Ib002564f54a0a6ae390a70908549fb5fc5a84372
"}]
commit_message:
assertTrue/False should have msg param

assertTrue / False should really have a msg param. Otherwise we
get the extremely descriptive True != False when the test fails.
Some times, that's ok.

But in the base case it's not. This doesn't yet fix any of the
issues, but is posted for consideration about whether we think
this would be helpful.

Change-Id: Ib002564f54a0a6ae390a70908549fb5fc5a84372

commit_message:
Switch to Horizon 2014.2.b2

There was a change merged to Horizon master a few days ago that upgrades
Twitter Bootstrap from version 2.x to version 3.x. There are lots changes
in the version upgrade that affect both CSS and JS.

Change-Id: I856aa0b8eb5ee44acbed74a7f6a49a037321bf91
Partly-Closes-Bug: #1349894

commit_message:
Include pending task in log message on skip sync_power_state

To better understand why sync_power_state is being skipped include the
pending task name in the log message.

commit_message:
versions API: ignore request with a body

Update the OS API versions controller so it ignores requests
with a body. Previously an incoming (unauthenticated)
request to the versions API would log a TypeError trace
in the nova-api.log file with the following message:

TypeError: index() got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'

Change-Id: Icc3ccfc537b13627b8d5ba43ae3ba91e34e08c9e
Closes-bug: #1306727

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8247, 'name': 'Thang Pham', 'email': 'thang.g.pham@gmail.com', 'username': 'thang.pham'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-05 21:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Refresh volume connection_info after volume snapshot

The following patch is related to the guest assisted snapshot
functionality.  When you take a snapshot of a volume
(e.g. GlusterFS) attached to a running instance, a new snapshot
file is created, i.e. volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  The
instance uses this file as the active volume.  If you shutdown
and restart the instance, nova will reattach the base volume
(volume-<uuid>) to the instance instead of the snapshot volume
(volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>).  The expected behavior is to
have the snapshot volume reattach to the instance.  This is
caused by stale data being returned from the database when
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info is called during
_power_on.  To fix this bug, this patch calls
refresh_connection_info to update the database in both
volume_snapshot_create and _volume_snapshot_delete methods of the
libvirt driver.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: I0f340a3f879580e7981d97863bc299e33d71aa84
Closes-Bug: #1304695
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Refresh volume connection_info after volume snapshot

The following patch is related to the guest assisted snapshot
functionality.  When you take a snapshot of a volume
(e.g. GlusterFS) attached to a running instance, a new snapshot
file is created, i.e. volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  The
instance uses this file as the active volume.  If you shutdown
and restart the instance, nova will reattach the base volume
(volume-<uuid>) to the instance instead of the snapshot volume
(volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>).  The expected behavior is to
have the snapshot volume reattach to the instance.  This is
caused by stale data being returned from the database when
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info is called during
_power_on.  To fix this bug, this patch calls
refresh_connection_info to update the database in both
volume_snapshot_create and _volume_snapshot_delete methods of the
libvirt driver.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: I0f340a3f879580e7981d97863bc299e33d71aa84
Closes-Bug: #1304695

commit_message:
Moving eventlet.hubs.use_hub call up

Under the design concept of eventlet, we need to call
eventlet.hubs.use_hub() before the application starts
doing any I/O. And it makes custom log handlers register
correct event listeners.

Closes-bug: 1247889
Change-Id: I3d43021c8cb6ed630123781f3686d62e5159edfc
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Fixes Hyper-V iSCSI target login method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8543, 'name': 'Lucian Petrut', 'email': 'lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'plucian'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-02 17:06:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/volumeutilsv2.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_volumeutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_volumeutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V iSCSI target login method

Hyper-V is trying to log in to portals/targets every time a volume
is attached, even if the portal/target was already connected. This
is not an issue with most volume backends, but it causes the attach
to fail when using Storwize as a Cinder backend.

This patch fixes the issue by checking if the target or portal is
already connected, and simply perform an update in this case,
instead of attempting to create a new connection.

Also, a retry loop is introduced for the case when the iSCSI target
login fails. As in this loop it is checked whether or not the
operation completed successfully, this method does not rely anymore
only on a sleep interval to ensure that the connection to the target
has been made. Even so, on V2 volume utilities, the sleep interval
is still needed to avoid having a new connection attempt before the
last one finished.

The method which gets the according mounted disk must raise an
exception when the device number is -1, which signifies that the
disk has not been mounted properly.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Closes-bug: #1221525

Change-Id: I92d2a586704fa3e857f46432bb571c81e86d183b
(cherry picked from commit ea91ad2b2317cb88fb14c0cdaf31187eca93ff57)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V iSCSI target login method

Hyper-V is trying to log in to portals/targets every time a volume
is attached, even if the portal/target was already connected. This
is not an issue with most volume backends, but it causes the attach
to fail when using Storwize as a Cinder backend.

This patch fixes the issue by checking if the target or portal is
already connected, and simply perform an update in this case,
instead of attempting to create a new connection.

Also, a retry loop is introduced for the case when the iSCSI target
login fails. As in this loop it is checked whether or not the
operation completed successfully, this method does not rely anymore
only on a sleep interval to ensure that the connection to the target
has been made. Even so, on V2 volume utilities, the sleep interval
is still needed to avoid having a new connection attempt before the
last one finished.

The method which gets the according mounted disk must raise an
exception when the device number is -1, which signifies that the
disk has not been mounted properly.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Closes-bug: #1221525

Change-Id: I92d2a586704fa3e857f46432bb571c81e86d183b
(cherry picked from commit ea91ad2b2317cb88fb14c0cdaf31187eca93ff57)

commit_message:
Don't specify admin_token in paste config

This is not a value that is going to be useful on other systems and
shouldn't be included in the default or test pipelines.

The two similar commits were squashed together here.

(cherry picked from commit ae696056fbac7d74a395710934950e0013cd4d37)
(cherry picked from commit 9db80e79ea3e687000121729648af7e79b7b2d78)

Closes-Bug: #1299332
Change-Id: I714539b7536965fa08a3ddc64493b481df7397e3

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-25 07:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/compute/v3/servers.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/servers_client.py', 'tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/servers.py', 'tempest/services/compute/v3/json/servers_client.py'], 'message': 'Check rescue_server action attributes of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 rescue server
action APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

For V3 API, "admin_password" in response body is depend on config
variable "enable_instance_password". So schema and request
is adjusted accordingly.
NOTE - V2 rescue API's response does not on above config variable.

The response body of rescue server V2 APIs is below:
{
    "adminPass": "%(password)s"
}

The response body of rescue server V3 APIs is below:
If CONF.enable_instance_password is true-
{
    "admin_password": "%(password)s"
}
Else
    {}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I85f18eaa58bfef1871100816f97487f9fa9bc0ee
'}]
commit_message:
Check rescue_server action attributes of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 rescue server
action APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

For V3 API, "admin_password" in response body is depend on config
variable "enable_instance_password". So schema and request
is adjusted accordingly.
NOTE - V2 rescue API's response does not on above config variable.

The response body of rescue server V2 APIs is below:
{
    "adminPass": "%(password)s"
}

The response body of rescue server V3 APIs is below:
If CONF.enable_instance_password is true-
{
    "admin_password": "%(password)s"
}
Else
    {}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I85f18eaa58bfef1871100816f97487f9fa9bc0ee

commit_message:
Use None instead of mutables in test method params defaults

Mutables in the method params defaults might cause errors and
that's why it's anti-pattern in most of the cases and should be
removed.

Change-Id: Ie9897aae6e95962e0991ac9d9fc5c175f2da12a4

commit_message:
Add context as param to cleanup function

In nova-network, when we start
to cleanup the stuffs it did when handle exception
but the function is following in objects/fixed_ips.py
def disassociate(self, context):
so the context param is lost and it can lead to problem.

Change-Id: I66a1681f47fc69bf0fd92137ee27481659833bef

Specify memcache servers for nova::controller

Specify all memcache servers instead of 127.0.0.1.
Otherwise, noVNC service will be broken

Configures logstash-web to start as a service. The upstream init script

commit_message:
Add logstash-web element

Configures logstash-web to start as a service. The upstream init script
has an error around CONF_DIR, which is unused anyway, so that has been
fixed. Additionally the http port has been changed to 19292 so as not to
conflict with Glance.

Advances blueprint logstash.

Change-Id: I4d552aab27fe9afab43c01364fad9d816c86ea1f

Now that HDFS data sources can be either full URLs
or paths relative to the cluster itself, it is no
longer desirable to force "hdfs://" at the start
of hdfs data sources.
* No longer force the prefix on the create form
* For swift, we now check to see that the location

Closes-Bug:  bug #1336283
'}]
commit_message:
Data Processing: Allowing for HDFS data sources without hdfs://

Now that HDFS data sources can be either full URLs
or paths relative to the cluster itself, it is no
longer desirable to force "hdfs://" at the start
of hdfs data sources.
* No longer force the prefix on the create form
* For swift, we now check to see that the location
  starts with swift://, if it doesn't we add it

Change-Id: I62a8fbad6d55505c2b82561fe3de706e5069c83f
Closes-Bug:  bug #1336283

subject: Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-25 16:50:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/base.py'], 'message': "Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped

The BaseNetworkTest class setUpClass() method will initialize
various class attributes which the tearDownClass() method
expects to exist. Unfortunately when Neutron is not
available, the entire of the setUpClass() method is skipped,
but tearDownClass() still runs. This causes the logs to get
polluted with errors about missing attributes during
tearDownClass(). eg

ERROR tempest.test [-] tearDownClass failed: type object
 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

Make the tearDownClass() code be conditional on neutron
being enabled too.

Change-Id: I042ca5c47e5c1e8d1042754fd7f36036a40b2f03
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped

The BaseNetworkTest class setUpClass() method will initialize
various class attributes which the tearDownClass() method
expects to exist. Unfortunately when Neutron is not
available, the entire of the setUpClass() method is skipped,
but tearDownClass() still runs. This causes the logs to get
polluted with errors about missing attributes during
tearDownClass(). eg

ERROR tempest.test [-] tearDownClass failed: type object
 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

Make the tearDownClass() code be conditional on neutron
being enabled too.

Change-Id: I042ca5c47e5c1e8d1042754fd7f36036a40b2f03

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-30 09:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/common/savanna_ssh.py'], 'message': 'Fix for SSH module of Sahara OSTF tests

In SSH method of Sahara OSTF tests address of controller node is chosen
as the first from list of controller nodes.
It may not work when we have a few controller nodes (HA mode) and one
of controller nodes went away. Now controller node is chosen
from list of controller nodes online.

Closes-Bug: #1346864

Change-Id: I74801a352c4a96e1fa1c254fd49db19d6584b427
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for SSH module of Sahara OSTF tests

In SSH method of Sahara OSTF tests address of controller node is chosen
as the first from list of controller nodes.
It may not work when we have a few controller nodes (HA mode) and one
of controller nodes went away. Now controller node is chosen
from list of controller nodes online.

Closes-Bug: #1346864

Change-Id: I74801a352c4a96e1fa1c254fd49db19d6584b427

commit_message:
Add bootstrap remote logs to rotation

Current rotation templates are missing the 2nd level
of directories inside of /var/log/remote/*/
and that is an issue due to bootstrap logs are residing
there as well.

Closes-bug: #1349809

Change-Id: If8f61220eeb897faf3ba403833564de85718b03d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

We have PERSONALITY property on OS::Nova::Server that defaults to {},
but code that triggers check for limits compares value of property
to None -> this property always get validated for limits (if limit is

Closes-bug: #1333283
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent excessive validation for maxPersonality limit

We have PERSONALITY property on OS::Nova::Server that defaults to {},
but code that triggers check for limits compares value of property
to None -> this property always get validated for limits (if limit is
set).

Change-Id: I552a03cd9f4ab570aa059349ab361bb50c9c0d1e
Closes-bug: #1333283

When running multiple proxy servers, memcache servers should be set
to point to all controller nodes (not only default localhost).

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-07-30 07:13:06.000000000', 'files': ['network_checker/network_checker/net_check/api.py'], 'message': 'Use tcpdump for traffic dumping in net_probe

I found out that tcpdump much more reliable than
python libpcap bindings, and works well under load

- start tcpdump listeners for each iface
  (will catch both tagged/untagged traffic)
- deserealize pcap data with help of scapy rdpcap util
- all pcap file will be stored in /var/run/pcap_dir by default
  and maybe attached to diagnostic snapshot

Change-Id: Id8320d4a05c84687c7a0a3d0ddbce4d05a7115ea
Closes-Bug: 1306705
'}]
commit_message:
Use tcpdump for traffic dumping in net_probe

I found out that tcpdump much more reliable than
python libpcap bindings, and works well under load

- start tcpdump listeners for each iface
  (will catch both tagged/untagged traffic)
- deserealize pcap data with help of scapy rdpcap util
- all pcap file will be stored in /var/run/pcap_dir by default
  and maybe attached to diagnostic snapshot

Change-Id: Id8320d4a05c84687c7a0a3d0ddbce4d05a7115ea
Closes-Bug: 1306705

subject: Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5892, 'name': 'pritesh', 'email': 'pritesh@romana.io', 'username': 'pritkoth'}, {'_account_id': 6316, 'name': 'Anita Kuno', 'email': 'anteaya@anteaya.info', 'username': 'anteaya'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-29 16:15:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but nova unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a
(cherry picked from commit 4f3e3cd1883ea5aca237bcc88b64128c743a6862)
"}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but nova unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a
(cherry picked from commit 4f3e3cd1883ea5aca237bcc88b64128c743a6862)

commit_message:
VCDriver - Ignore host in Maintenance mode in stats update

The VCDriver during stats update checks only for connected hosts.
However hosts which are in connected state to the Cluster can
be set to Maintenance mode.
The cluster does not boot instances to hosts which are in
maintenance mode.
Hence the VCDriver should check for hosts which are in
maintenance mode and ignore them for stats update.
VISDK API returns True for the property inMaintenanceMode for
Hosts which are in maintenance mode

Change-Id: Ieaf7530ed2d98c59c5450e8cb75e209823193d49
Closes-Bug: #1316674
(cherry picked from commit 4cb139fb99814f04b9e4595d7e2efa34e7992826)

With Paramiko 1.13.0, the method exec_command now returns Unicode.
This causes a problem when the driver tries to build the XML returned
from the LeftHand array. The XML header returned from the array defines
the encoding as encoding=UTF-8. Therefore, we must now ensure the

commit_message:
Fixes HP LeftHand driver with Paramiko 1.13.0

With Paramiko 1.13.0, the method exec_command now returns Unicode.
This causes a problem when the driver tries to build the XML returned
from the LeftHand array. The XML header returned from the array defines
the encoding as encoding=UTF-8. Therefore, we must now ensure the
encoding passed to the parser is utf-8.

Change-Id: I7b504626e2d9a0ee2b62820b11f56eb136e31987
closes-bug: #1298608
(cherry picked from commit 57e8cdb9dd8e24919bc2243438a6bded53491b3e)

commit_message:
Do not consume trust uses when create token fails

Currently, remaining trust uses are consumed even when create token
fails. We should only consume trust uses when successfully creating
a token.

Change-Id: I55a726250312fa81ed9556dfd530e96f72548930
Closes-Bug: #1335037

commit_message:
Fix rxtx_factor name for creating a flavor

On v3 API, rxtx_factor parameters has been renamed to
'os-flavor-rxtx:rxtx_factor' for consistent interfaces.
This patch applies it to 'nova flavor-create' command.

Closes-Bug: #1350022
Change-Id: I49e24f0220f87616f346f36973312b2f29333841

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 cells API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ic400a31fe2c05e07785a2dc6c4fd864e684f4965

commit_message:
Fix broken API os-migrations

The return is not what we are expecting:
  migration-list: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'

The conversion of the object nova.objects.MigrationList into a list
is not applied automatically.

Closes-Bug: #1260249
(cherry picked from commit 4963fa0fa0d96d8641339614438d42c81958f728)

Conflicts:

	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrations.py

Modified:

	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrations.py

Change-Id: I620ea252969884455d66d0313c0ad27f560ae476

subject: This changes allows a server to tagged with backup so that it is defined as a backup server, to be used only if a non-backup server is down.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-31 09:43:28.000000000', 'files': ['elements/haproxy/os-apply-config/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg'], 'message': 'This changes allows a server to tagged with backup
so that it is defined as a backup server,
to be used only if a non-backup server is down.

The default haproxy configuration of "balance source"
only guarantees that all traffic from one client
goes to one server. Where we may need to guarantee
that all traffic from one service goes to one
server (e.g. in the case of MySQL traffic ) we
may need to allow backup to be specified in the
haproxy configuration see
Ia9d6ed2771f756d2a97ae5df7ed737a062a59cf2 here.

Change-Id: I4d4c68c6d15fbd29211ebd4a213db43b1d5ebf11
'}]
commit_message:
This changes allows a server to tagged with backup
so that it is defined as a backup server,
to be used only if a non-backup server is down.

The default haproxy configuration of "balance source"
only guarantees that all traffic from one client
goes to one server. Where we may need to guarantee
that all traffic from one service goes to one
server (e.g. in the case of MySQL traffic ) we
may need to allow backup to be specified in the
haproxy configuration see
Ia9d6ed2771f756d2a97ae5df7ed737a062a59cf2 here.

Change-Id: I4d4c68c6d15fbd29211ebd4a213db43b1d5ebf11

The __len__ method will make boolean checks on the VirtNUMATopology
objects work the same way they do for lists (which is reasonably
intuitive given that we really just wrap the list of cells).

has_usage_info is there to distinguish between host and guest topologies
(usage info makes no sense in guest case so we don't want it there).
This will help us keep serialized data clean and in stable format.

Change-Id: I25090fcbb3c16d89196ad37f8433ccaa62c5a72d
"}]
commit_message:
Add __len__ and has_usage_info to VirtNUMATopology

The __len__ method will make boolean checks on the VirtNUMATopology
objects work the same way they do for lists (which is reasonably
intuitive given that we really just wrap the list of cells).

has_usage_info is there to distinguish between host and guest topologies
(usage info makes no sense in guest case so we don't want it there).
This will help us keep serialized data clean and in stable format.

Change-Id: I25090fcbb3c16d89196ad37f8433ccaa62c5a72d

commit_message:
Use corosync.nodes when creating list of nodes in corosync cluster

List of nodes is specified in 'corosync' context. This allows
more fine-grained customization of corosync list of nodes independently
on list of controllers nodes.

Neither 'controllers' nor 'corosync.nodes' are currently defined in
our heat templates.

Change-Id: I086a31c24500d372f86412e6e349be7797929ddd

This patch removes all logic form sqlalchemy's data driver. The
motivation behind this is that we don't recommend people to use this
driver in production nor we want to maintain it. Folks interested in
this driver can use it - or implement it - as an external driver.

Note that the ControlDriver is kept because it's still possible to use
sqlalchemy to keep pools, catalogue and flavors data.

Implements blueprint: disable-sqlalchemy-as-pool

Change-Id: I00690ea0f4bf19705b615077c5b22430af1002d2

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy's DataDriver

This patch removes all logic form sqlalchemy's data driver. The
motivation behind this is that we don't recommend people to use this
driver in production nor we want to maintain it. Folks interested in
this driver can use it - or implement it - as an external driver.

Note that the ControlDriver is kept because it's still possible to use
sqlalchemy to keep pools, catalogue and flavors data.

Implements blueprint: disable-sqlalchemy-as-pool

Change-Id: I00690ea0f4bf19705b615077c5b22430af1002d2

The functional gate jobs (*-neutron-dsvm-functional) need special
configuration (e.g. OS_SUDO_TESTING, OS_ROOTWRAP_CMD) to run tests.
This patch adds a new gate-specific tox env (tox -e dsvm-functional)
that sets the appropriate values and allows easy duplication of the
results of the upstream job on a host that has successfully run
devstack with neutron enabled.

A new configuration option, OS_FAIL_ON_MISSING_DEPS, is also set by
the dsvm-functional tox env to ensure that dependency failures will
result in failures rather than skips when run in the gate.

Change-Id: Idbfef1ba72ed129a3021509c7969e2685b8a6d09
Partial-bug: #1336172
'}]
commit_message:
Add a gate-specific tox env for functional tests

The functional gate jobs (*-neutron-dsvm-functional) need special
configuration (e.g. OS_SUDO_TESTING, OS_ROOTWRAP_CMD) to run tests.
This patch adds a new gate-specific tox env (tox -e dsvm-functional)
that sets the appropriate values and allows easy duplication of the
results of the upstream job on a host that has successfully run
devstack with neutron enabled.

A new configuration option, OS_FAIL_ON_MISSING_DEPS, is also set by
the dsvm-functional tox env to ensure that dependency failures will
result in failures rather than skips when run in the gate.

Change-Id: Idbfef1ba72ed129a3021509c7969e2685b8a6d09
Partial-bug: #1336172

commit_message:
Create Ubuntu chroot in a single command

Add separate 'chroot-ubuntu' command to 'make' scripts.
It will provide possibility to setup basic Ubuntu system
into chroot environment in a single command:
~/fuel-main/make chroot-ubuntu

Change-Id: Ib03ac8370832e6eaa5df9cac90fb9eb114c4ba0e

commit_message:
Requeu and acknowledge logic for server

- no_ack should not be used with requeu implementation at same time
rejecting message when no_ack set leads to:
PRECONDITION_FAILED - unknown delivery tag

- metadata.ack will guarantee that message is delivered and started
processing

Change-Id: I15d940f635b1d0f80ac1eaefc8f37a3080e7f4d2
Closes-Bug: 1349399

commit_message:
Opencontrail network statistics driver

This patch introduces a network statistics driver
for Opencontrail. Only port statistics are currently
returned by the driver.

Implements: blueprint meter-from-opencontrail
Co-Authored-By: Edouard Thuleau <edouard.thuleau@cloudwatt.com>
Change-Id: Ic0afc478362fb4170903ee4e3723b82cd6c723fa
(cherry picked from commit 6e0f4d9bd9c7f3b957adc6f73bf1a48c8c120e1b)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-31 04:38:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_manage.py'], 'message': 'Use WSGI framework on test_flavor_manage

On test_flavor_manage, The test of "delete a flavor" API only calls
its API method directly, and the other tests use WSGI framework.
In addition, NotFound test passes wrong URL(/v2/123/flavors/1234)
it should be /v2/123/flavors/failtest instead. WSGI framework gets
flavor-id from the URL, the passes it to API method.

This patch makes the test use WSGI framework and separates NotFound
test for easy debugging.

Change-Id: Iec580f248718e7db64f1955bd47dcc7a35b33f9e
'}]
commit_message:
Use WSGI framework on test_flavor_manage

On test_flavor_manage, The test of "delete a flavor" API only calls
its API method directly, and the other tests use WSGI framework.
In addition, NotFound test passes wrong URL(/v2/123/flavors/1234)
it should be /v2/123/flavors/failtest instead. WSGI framework gets
flavor-id from the URL, the passes it to API method.

This patch makes the test use WSGI framework and separates NotFound
test for easy debugging.

Change-Id: Iec580f248718e7db64f1955bd47dcc7a35b33f9e

commit_message:
Fixing DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message

Accessing BaseException message attribute is deprecated since py2.6,
In several cases it generates a lot of error messages into the log
files.

"".join(map(str, operational_error.args)) looks like a working
alternative.

Change-Id: I0f4753bb64dc08d43d5b4c7269342bc6b781254c
Closes-Bug: #1257530

commit_message:
transformer: Add aggregator transformer

This adds a transformer aggregate counters until a threshold and/or a
retention time and then flushing them out.

Also cherry picked bug-fixes related to this commit.

Change-Id: If4a950e585fe5309ddec58ed2c9a92928ac1acb2
Co-Authored-By: Jordan Pittier <jordan.pittier@cloudwatt.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6957e7b66aa37685ec0d75fe7ef65cdab981d55f)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1215, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal Nóbrega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 9275, 'name': 'Leandro Ignacio Costantino', 'email': 'leandro.i.costantino@intel.com', 'username': 'lcostantino'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 15:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix the image name of a shelved server

The shelve feature powers a server off, and creates a snapshot of the
server. The snapshot image name is "instance-XXXXXXXXX-shelved" and it
doesn't contain a server name like the following:

  $ nova list
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks         |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | .. | vm01 | ACTIVE | None       | Running     | private=10.0.0.5 |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  $ nova shelve vm01
  $ nova image-list
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name                            | Status | Server |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | instance-00000004-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  $

"instance-XXXXXXXXX" is OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name, and a non-admin
cannot see it.

This patch changes the name to "<server name>-shelved", so that a non-
admin user can know the server name of a shelved image:

  $ nova image-list
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name               | Status | Server |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | vm01-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  $

Closes-Bug: 1232991
(cherry picked from commit abec25a7bafa4ca320ae222a34fc45ad3c1d27a8)

Change-Id: Iad0126ade096f2ef30dc510346b4840fabf7066d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the image name of a shelved server

The shelve feature powers a server off, and creates a snapshot of the
server. The snapshot image name is "instance-XXXXXXXXX-shelved" and it
doesn't contain a server name like the following:

  $ nova list
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | ID | Name | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks         |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  | .. | vm01 | ACTIVE | None       | Running     | private=10.0.0.5 |
  +----+------+--------+------------+-------------+------------------+
  $ nova shelve vm01
  $ nova image-list
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name                            | Status | Server |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | instance-00000004-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
  $

"instance-XXXXXXXXX" is OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name, and a non-admin
cannot see it.

This patch changes the name to "<server name>-shelved", so that a non-
admin user can know the server name of a shelved image:

  $ nova image-list
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | ID | Name               | Status | Server |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  | .. | vm01-shelved       | ACTIVE | ..     |
  +----+--------------------+--------+--------+
  $

Closes-Bug: 1232991
(cherry picked from commit abec25a7bafa4ca320ae222a34fc45ad3c1d27a8)

Change-Id: Iad0126ade096f2ef30dc510346b4840fabf7066d

subject: Don't try to restore VM's in state ERROR.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4468, 'name': 'Wangpan', 'email': 'hzwangpan@corp.netease.com', 'username': 'hzwangpan'}, {'_account_id': 4601, 'name': 'Tiago Mello', 'email': 'tmello@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'tmello'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-20 06:29:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't try to restore VM's in state ERROR.

We don't try to restore VM's that are in a failed BUILDING state, so
attempting to start ERROR VMs is more than a little weird. The one
exception to this rule are VMs that are in RESIZE_MIGRATING, since
recovery is already attempted. It's also a problem, because many ERROR
states aren't recoverable from (at the moment anyhow).

Closes-Bug: #1272623
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6534a89de9cabc274cbdb7d2ecee3d851c456a87)

Conflicts:

	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Change-Id: I7cbcf4c7d637911c4931d3be9baf91a1da69da90
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try to restore VM's in state ERROR.

We don't try to restore VM's that are in a failed BUILDING state, so
attempting to start ERROR VMs is more than a little weird. The one
exception to this rule are VMs that are in RESIZE_MIGRATING, since
recovery is already attempted. It's also a problem, because many ERROR
states aren't recoverable from (at the moment anyhow).

Closes-Bug: #1272623
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6534a89de9cabc274cbdb7d2ecee3d851c456a87)

Conflicts:

	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Change-Id: I7cbcf4c7d637911c4931d3be9baf91a1da69da90

commit_message:
Ensure parent dir exists while injecting files

Currently, if we inject a file to a not existing path,
the injecting will be failed with error 'No such file
or directory'.
Nova will firstly execute `mkdir -p` in folsom before injecting,
but this operation is lost from commit
72918415f2b6a241d6097a563aba55a849936591

This patch fix this bug by adding the `mkdir -p` operation as folsom.

Closes-bug: #1272829

Change-Id: I117c74e2a3a9ca87232cbd41a9c1ef9fc57d03f4
(cherry picked from af8972a21b1f6da7ef470bae52fdbd47c3a5afeb)

commit_message:
Adds https support for metadata agent

Adds two configure options to support https client for metadata proxy
* auth_insecure: turn off verification of the certificate for ssl, or
* auth_ca_cert: CA cert to check against with for ssl.

Change-Id: I3ffb86ae9ce31931436a4e13957aae30eebf9d92
Closes-Bug: #1263872
(cherry picked from commit a06c2f6cbdff64bdc9750b57cb8782cc337774ff)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-29 16:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but nova unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a
(cherry picked from commit 4f3e3cd1883ea5aca237bcc88b64128c743a6862)
"}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but nova unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a
(cherry picked from commit 4f3e3cd1883ea5aca237bcc88b64128c743a6862)

commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: Ic0d18302b9992706285990a8230f75c2ab16d0a2

Can't seem to get the test:

to run right, tried macports and homebrew versions of fileutils
but still get makedir failures. Give up and just detect if OSX
and skip.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7746, 'name': 'Dan Genin', 'email': 'daniel.genin@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'DiG'}, {'_account_id': 8412, 'name': 'Mike Durnosvistov', 'email': 'glacierr.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdurnosvistov'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-30 16:00:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt re-define guest with wrong XML document

In the nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py file, the '_live_snapshot' and
'_swap_volume' methods have the following code flow
  xml = dom.XMLDesc(0)
  dom.undefine()
  dom.blockRebase()
  dom.defineXML(xml)
The reason for this is that 'blockRebase' requires the guest to be
transient, so we must temporarily delete the persistent config and
then re-create it later.
Unfortunately this code is using the wrong XML document when
re-creating the persistent config. 'dom.XMLDesc(0)' will return the
guest XML document based on the current guest state. Since the guest
is running in both these cases, it will get getting the *live* XML
instead of the persistent XML.So these methods are deleting the
persistent XML and replacing it with the live XML. These two
different XML documents are not guaranteed to contain the same
information.
As a second problem, it is not requesting inclusion of security
information, so any SPICE/VNC password set in the persistent XML
is getting lost.

Change-Id: I4b4e0990ca6c07a9215766f994884a1fb18f3a41
Closes-Bug: #1346191
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt re-define guest with wrong XML document

In the nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py file, the '_live_snapshot' and
'_swap_volume' methods have the following code flow
  xml = dom.XMLDesc(0)
  dom.undefine()
  dom.blockRebase()
  dom.defineXML(xml)
The reason for this is that 'blockRebase' requires the guest to be
transient, so we must temporarily delete the persistent config and
then re-create it later.
Unfortunately this code is using the wrong XML document when
re-creating the persistent config. 'dom.XMLDesc(0)' will return the
guest XML document based on the current guest state. Since the guest
is running in both these cases, it will get getting the *live* XML
instead of the persistent XML.So these methods are deleting the
persistent XML and replacing it with the live XML. These two
different XML documents are not guaranteed to contain the same
information.
As a second problem, it is not requesting inclusion of security
information, so any SPICE/VNC password set in the persistent XML
is getting lost.

Change-Id: I4b4e0990ca6c07a9215766f994884a1fb18f3a41
Closes-Bug: #1346191

commit_message:
Add trace logging to allocate_fixed_ip

The address is being logged as None in some cases
that are failing in grenade jobs so this adds more
trace logging to the base network manager's
allocate_fixed_ip method so we can see which paths
are being taken in the code and what the outputs
are.

Change-Id: I37de4b3bbb9e51b57eb4d048e05fc00382eed23d
Related-Bug: #1349617

commit_message:
Disable specifying alarm itself in combination rule

Currently, update combination alarm can specify itself in alarm_ids,
however, that will cause endless loop when evaluating this alarm.

This patch adds a check to disable such behavior.

Change-Id: I63b465c59fe39206ae04b0736482d1ffd7bf59c4
Closes-Bug: #1304419
(cherry picked from commit de8176fa736ffa9c4d6b0a57a8db2f58083f124a)

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V Inspector network metrics values

The Hyper-V inspector is currently returning the wrong metric values. The
current values are the aggregated ones, which is not correct in scenarios
in which instances have more than one nic.
Furthermore, values were taken from the
Msvm_EthernetPortAllocationSettingData, instead of
Msvm_EthernetSwitchPortAclSettingData.

(cherry picked from commit 01190ccee364dc061038ef7d8f3cc701c8d447ba)

Change-Id: I669ff52a1be2ee56bf69aa3b680ab42fdcaf1cb7
Closes-bug: #1289014

commit_message:
Update log message for add_host_to_aggregate

When add host to aggregates with availability zone, if the host
is already in one availability zone, then the host cannot be added
to another availability zone.

When user do above operation, nova api will report error message,
but the error message does not include blank space between
<availability zone> and zone name, also the error message include
two periods.

The fix was adding blank space and removes one period for the message.

Change-Id: I7307288be194d3ce6de05b77433bbe2626ae46d9
Closes-bug: #1237303
(cherry picked from commit c2ae5fb5659faeadc6f4d8afe27eb68e3c0ade0c)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-14 15:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_virt.py', 'nova/virt/disk/mount/api.py', 'nova/virt/disk/mount/nbd.py', 'etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters'], 'message': 'Fix for qemu-nbd hang

NBD device once used seem to run into intermittent trouble when
used with mount repeatedly. Adding code to explicitly flush the
device buffers using 'blockdev --flushbufs'.

NOTE(dmllr): Also merged regression fix:

    Consolidate the blockdev related filters

    Seeing a "/usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap: Unauthorized command" error
    in the logs when  "blockdev --flushbufs" is executed because of the
    existing blockdev in compute.filters. We need to merge both into a
    single RegExpFilter

    Change-Id: Ic323ff00e5c23786a6e376e67a4ad08f92708aef

(cherry-picked from dd3f96e91581f465a52d10a212eb51b147dc38b5)
(cherry-picked from 31b2791e6be1768c410de5fa32283fcb637bda57)

Closes-Bug: #973413
Partial-Bug: #1254890
Change-Id: I2b7053b9a069d6e82f6f6baf9ad480efa4388d91
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for qemu-nbd hang

NBD device once used seem to run into intermittent trouble when
used with mount repeatedly. Adding code to explicitly flush the
device buffers using 'blockdev --flushbufs'.

NOTE(dmllr): Also merged regression fix:

    Consolidate the blockdev related filters

    Seeing a "/usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap: Unauthorized command" error
    in the logs when  "blockdev --flushbufs" is executed because of the
    existing blockdev in compute.filters. We need to merge both into a
    single RegExpFilter

    Change-Id: Ic323ff00e5c23786a6e376e67a4ad08f92708aef

(cherry-picked from dd3f96e91581f465a52d10a212eb51b147dc38b5)
(cherry-picked from 31b2791e6be1768c410de5fa32283fcb637bda57)

Closes-Bug: #973413
Partial-Bug: #1254890
Change-Id: I2b7053b9a069d6e82f6f6baf9ad480efa4388d91

commit_message:
Add option to disable server password fields

Not many hypervisors support setting a server admin password via Nova.
This change adds an item to OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES called
'can_set_password' that controls whether password settings fields
are displayed in the UI.

Change-Id: I03399c171b2b7cbf756292cee283419d6235461f
Closes-bug: #1250713
(cherry picked from commit e4288adbf1d0cec5067ee9a7db816b8cbda43f85)

Conflicts:
	doc/source/topics/settings.rst
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py

Change-Id: I3d49da36fe6a5034ca006170dce964e2046c4cab

Add architecture to tempest configuration

Cirros may be also built in other architectures other than
x86_64 (ex: ppc). This option should be broader,
so adding a new variable CIRROS_ARCH

subject: Qpid: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3098, 'name': 'Jeff Peeler', 'email': 'jpeeler@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpeeler-z'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-17 18:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': "Qpid: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

Sync 877f1cab328fe8a9f8214687ea7e1287862de87d from oslo-incubator's
stable/havana branch.

In Qpid implementation, when using multiple qpid_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Change-Id: I5a630e76880c0d4219c4a8a2b3354e41899d9695
Partial-Bug: 1261631
"}]
commit_message:
Qpid: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

Sync 877f1cab328fe8a9f8214687ea7e1287862de87d from oslo-incubator's
stable/havana branch.

In Qpid implementation, when using multiple qpid_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Change-Id: I5a630e76880c0d4219c4a8a2b3354e41899d9695
Partial-Bug: 1261631

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-25 21:47:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': "Fix cinder volume type creation and rename variable

Commit 7062b12b9b91a1eb405d7079c62b62b0de59109f introduced
a bug where the default_volume_type is set to 'lvm' but
that is not the volume-type that's actually created, that
is 'lvmdriver-1' in gate runs, so we see a ton of
VolumeTypeNotFoundByName for the 'lvm' volume type in the
cinder-api logs.

This simply sets the default_volume_type to the volume
type that's created in the create_volume_types function.

Also renames the default_type variable to default_name to
be consistent with variable naming in the rest of the
cinder script.

Change-Id: Ib35ffc09f6582354010ac8ca35da581ea508877a
Closes-Bug: #1348786
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder volume type creation and rename variable

Commit 7062b12b9b91a1eb405d7079c62b62b0de59109f introduced
a bug where the default_volume_type is set to 'lvm' but
that is not the volume-type that's actually created, that
is 'lvmdriver-1' in gate runs, so we see a ton of
VolumeTypeNotFoundByName for the 'lvm' volume type in the
cinder-api logs.

This simply sets the default_volume_type to the volume
type that's created in the create_volume_types function.

Also renames the default_type variable to default_name to
be consistent with variable naming in the rest of the
cinder script.

Change-Id: Ib35ffc09f6582354010ac8ca35da581ea508877a
Closes-Bug: #1348786

commit_message:
Support of an alternate pypi server

Currently pip will get the package from the https://pypi.python.org server.
For CI, it's a problem as Internet connection can be down,
the pypi server down, etc...

The usecase is for a company/user that maintain a local pypi mirror
and give the option to use this server instead of the official one

Change-Id: I83aac4646cb78827a92c9636d78238f8a6118642
Implements: blueprint support-local-pypi-server

commit_message:
Pin horizon

Pin horizon to a specific commit before a regression was introduced.
Reverting the commit no longer works as it has conflicts. Support for
git hashes in source-repositories doesn't seem to work in CI, so instead
temporarily pull a known working version from a commit before the problem
was merged.

Related-Bug: #1349774

Change-Id: I82469018034ad815447ddc8a8a40e3a911252ca6

commit_message:
Use random binary data for test images

There have been some complaints that the image api testing does nothing
to verify the actual path of uploading binary image data. Since binary
data is the norm rather than the exception, this patch modifies most
usage of image data to be randomly selected binary data.

Change-Id: I54457ed3aea14b540820b5e451c529831074a7bf

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-05 16:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vhdutilsv2.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vhdutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V differencing image resizing

VHDX differencing images cannot be resized on Hyper-V as the
requested size is not specified when creating the image.

When creating an instance using VHDX differencing images, the base
image is not resized like in the case of VHD. Instead, the flavor
size must be specified when creating the root image.

The method which gets the internal size of an image for a
requested maximum phyisical size raises an exception in case of
differencing images. Instead, this method should be called on
the parent image, getting the requested size.

Fixes bug: #1294682
(cherry-picked from commit I460f4e27907b1b10489019266d7eb9bb26292261)

Change-Id: I460f4e27907b1b10489019266d7eb9bb26292261
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V differencing image resizing

VHDX differencing images cannot be resized on Hyper-V as the
requested size is not specified when creating the image.

When creating an instance using VHDX differencing images, the base
image is not resized like in the case of VHD. Instead, the flavor
size must be specified when creating the root image.

The method which gets the internal size of an image for a
requested maximum phyisical size raises an exception in case of
differencing images. Instead, this method should be called on
the parent image, getting the requested size.

Fixes bug: #1294682
(cherry-picked from commit I460f4e27907b1b10489019266d7eb9bb26292261)

Change-Id: I460f4e27907b1b10489019266d7eb9bb26292261

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V differencing image resizing

VHDX differencing images cannot be resized on Hyper-V as the
requested size is not specified when creating the image.

When creating an instance using VHDX differencing images, the base
image is not resized like in the case of VHD. Instead, the flavor
size must be specified when creating the root image.

The method which gets the internal size of an image for a
requested maximum phyisical size raises an exception in case of
differencing images. Instead, this method should be called on
the parent image, getting the requested size.

Fixes bug: #1294682

(cherry-picked from commit I460f4e27907b1b10489019266d7eb9bb26292261)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vhdutils.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-21 06:56:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Add lock for limit check on keypairs.

Keypairs in particular seems to be vulnerable to race conditions.
It's checked against their quotas by getting a
count of existing keypairs and then checking count + 1 against the limit.

This patch adds a lock which only used for DB access.

Closes-Bug: #1301532

Change-Id: I5c93a334500f9c6eb7e357da1773fb1e9931fb3a
"}]
commit_message:
Add lock for limit check on keypairs.

Keypairs in particular seems to be vulnerable to race conditions.
It's checked against their quotas by getting a
count of existing keypairs and then checking count + 1 against the limit.

This patch adds a lock which only used for DB access.

Closes-Bug: #1301532

Change-Id: I5c93a334500f9c6eb7e357da1773fb1e9931fb3a
